alert.note: Alert for Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 8:40AM CDT until June 04 at 2:49PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Washita River near Clinton affecting Custer and Washita Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Washita River near Clinton. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Approximately one thousand acres of rural lands are covered by depths up to a foot... from areas near the mouth of Barnitz Creek... to near Clinton in Custer County... and downstream to near the town of Cloud Chief in Washita County. greater depths may be confined to small areas where local streams enter the Washita River valley. Some farmsteads may be flooded or isolated by water over local roads. Some farm levees may be overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The Washita River has crested and is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM CDT.
